docstr: `SHIFTA` â€” Right shift with fill ### Description `SHIFTA` returns a value corresponding to `I` with all of the bits shifted right by `SHIFT` places. If the absolute value of `SHIFT` is greater than `BIT_SIZE(I)`, the value is undefined. Bits shifted out from the right end are lost. The fill is arithmetic: the bits shifted in from the left end are equal to the leftmost bit, which in two's complement representation is the sign bit. ### Syntax `RESULT = SHIFTA(I, SHIFT)` ### Arguments . | `SHIFT` | The type shall be `INTEGER`. ### Return value The return value is of type `INTEGER` and of the same kind as `I`. ### Standard Fortran 2008 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also SHIFTL, SHIFTR
